com.madrobot.graphics.svg

Class SVGFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.madrobot.graphics.svg.SVGFactory

  • public class SVGFactory
extends Object
    Entry point for parsing SVG files for Android. Use one of the various static methods for parsing SVGs by resource, asset or input stream. Optionally, a single color can be searched and replaced in the SVG while parsing. You can also parse an svg path directly.
    See Also:
    getSVGFromResource(Resources, int, int), getSVGFromAsset(AssetManager, String, int), getSVGFromString(String, int), getSVGFromInputStream(InputStream, int)

    • Method Detail

      • getSVGFromInputStream

        public static SVG getSVGFromInputStream(InputStream svgData,
                        int zoomFactor)
                                 throws SVGException
        Parse SVG data from an input stream.
        Parameters:
        svgData - the input stream, with SVG XML data in UTF-8 character encoding.
        zoomFactor - The factor by which the SVG should be zoomed. 100 indicates that the SVG will be rendered in its actual size, 200 means twice its size,50 means half its size and so on.
        Returns:
        the parsed SVG.
        Throws:
        SVGException - if there is an error while parsing.

      • getSVGFromString

        public static SVG getSVGFromString(String svgData,
                   int zoomFactor)
                            throws SVGException
        Parse SVG data from a string.
        Parameters:
        svgData - the string containing SVG XML data.
        zoomFactor - The factor by which the SVG should be zoomed. 100 indicates that the SVG will be rendered in its actual size, 200 means twice its size,50 means half its size and so on.
        Returns:
        the parsed SVG.
        Throws:
        SVGException - if there is an error while parsing.

      • getSVGFromByteArray

        public static SVG getSVGFromByteArray(byte[] svgData,
                      int zoomFactor)
                               throws SVGException
        Parse SVG from a byte array
        Parameters:
        svgData -
        zoomFactor - The factor by which the SVG should be zoomed. 100 indicates that the SVG will be rendered in its actual size, 200 means twice its size,50 means half its size and so on.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        SVGException

      • getSVGFromResource

        public static SVG getSVGFromResource(Resources resources,
                     int resId,
                     int zoomFactor)
                              throws SVGException
        Parse SVG data from an Android application resource.

        This is a blocking operation and should be done preferably on a non-UI thread.

        Parameters:
        resources - the Android context resources.
        resId - the ID of the raw resource SVG.
        zoomFactor - The factor by which the SVG should be zoomed. 100 indicates that the SVG will be rendered in its actual size, 200 means twice its size,50 means half its size and so on.
        Returns:
        the parsed SVG.
        Throws:
        SVGException - if there is an error while parsing.

      • getSVGFromAsset

        public static SVG getSVGFromAsset(AssetManager assetMngr,
                  String svgPath,
                  int zoomFactor)
                           throws SVGException,
                                  IOException
        Parse SVG data from an Android application asset.

        This is a blocking operation and should be done preferably on a non-UI thread.

        Parameters:
        assetMngr - the Android asset manager.
        svgPath - the path to the SVG file in the application's assets.
        zoomFactor - The factor by which the SVG should be zoomed. 100 indicates that the SVG will be rendered in its actual size, 200 means twice its size,50 means half its size and so on.
        Returns:
        the parsed SVG.
        Throws:
        SVGException - if there is an error while parsing.
        IOException - if there was a problem reading the file.

      • getSVGFromInputStream

        public static SVG getSVGFromInputStream(InputStream svgData,
                        int searchColor,
                        int replaceColor,
                        int zoomFactor)
                                 throws SVGException
        Parse SVG data from an input stream, replacing a single color with another color.

        This is a blocking operation and should be done preferably on a non-UI thread.

        Parameters:
        svgData - the input stream, with SVG XML data in UTF-8 character encoding.
        searchColor - the color in the SVG to replace.
        replaceColor - the color with which to replace the search color.
        zoomFactor - The factor by which the SVG should be zoomed. 100 indicates that the SVG will be rendered in its actual size, 200 means twice its size,50 means half its size and so on.
        Returns:
        the parsed SVG.
        Throws:
        SVGException - if there is an error while parsing.

      • getSVGFromString

        public static SVG getSVGFromString(String svgData,
                   int searchColor,
                   int replaceColor,
                   int zoomFactor)
                            throws SVGException
        Parse SVG data from a string.

        This is a blocking operation and should be done preferably on a non-UI thread.

        Parameters:
        svgData - the string containing SVG XML data.
        searchColor - the color in the SVG to replace.
        replaceColor - the color with which to replace the search color.
        zoomFactor - The factor by which the SVG should be zoomed. 100 indicates that the SVG will be rendered in its actual size, 200 means twice its size,50 means half its size and so on.
        Returns:
        the parsed SVG.
        Throws:
        SVGException - if there is an error while parsing.

      • getSVGFromResource

        public static SVG getSVGFromResource(Resources resources,
                     int resId,
                     int searchColor,
                     int replaceColor,
                     int zoomFactor)
                              throws SVGException
        Parse SVG data from an Android application resource.

        This is a blocking operation and should be done preferably on a non-UI thread.

        Parameters:
        resources - the Android context
        resId - the ID of the raw resource SVG.
        searchColor - the color in the SVG to replace.
        replaceColor - the color with which to replace the search color.
        zoomFactor - The factor by which the SVG should be zoomed. 100 indicates that the SVG will be rendered in its actual size, 200 means twice its size,50 means half its size and so on.
        Returns:
        the parsed SVG.
        Throws:
        SVGException - if there is an error while parsing.

      • getSVGFromAsset

        public static SVG getSVGFromAsset(AssetManager assetMngr,
                  String svgPath,
                  int searchColor,
                  int replaceColor,
                  int zoomFactor)
                           throws SVGException,
                                  IOException
        Parse SVG data from an Android application asset.

        This is a blocking operation and should be done preferably on a non-UI thread.

        Parameters:
        assetMngr - the Android asset manager.
        svgPath - the path to the SVG file in the application's assets.
        searchColor - the color in the SVG to replace.
        replaceColor - the color with which to replace the search color.
        zoomFactor - The factor by which the SVG should be zoomed. 100 indicates that the SVG will be rendered in its actual size, 200 means twice its size,50 means half its size and so on.
        Returns:
        the parsed SVG.
        Throws:
        SVGException - if there is an error while parsing.
        IOException - if there was a problem reading the file.
